Recent News Categories All Categories Alumni Spotlight Awards and Honors Department News Research Student Experience Apply Filters Chatbots tell people what they want to hear Categories Research Department News A Johns Hopkins-led team found that chatbots reinforce our biases, providing insight into how AI could widen the public divide on controversial issues. Celebrating the 2024 department and school awardees Categories Awards and Honors Department News Student Experience Outstanding students and faculty were honored at the annual Computer Science Department Awards Ceremony. Anqi Liu receives Amazon Research Award Categories Awards and Honors The award for AI research funds the development of open-source tools and research to advance the frontiers of machine learning. Grounding COVID-19’s flight plan: Students simulate viral spread in airports Categories Student Experience A project with Amazon Web Services offers insight into the disease’s transmission. Solving puzzles for prey at the Maryland Zoo Categories Student Experience Johns Hopkins undergraduate engineers bring the thrill of the hunt to bobcats Kilgore and Josie with their high-tech take on the classic “Whac-A-Mole” arcade game. New student ventures win Singhal Family Entrepreneurship Awards Categories Student Experience Awards and Honors The awards will help launch the student-run software ventures by providing their teams with the resources needed to translate their innovative concepts into viable products. An AI that really cares about the big C Categories Student Experience A multidisciplinary student team designed an AI-powered chatbot to answer cancer patients’ questions accurately and empathetically. AI lawyers need to hit the books: Study finds LLMs flunk Law 101 Categories Research Johns Hopkins researchers compare GPT models to “sloppy paralegals.” Yinzhi Cao to participate in DARPA competition Categories Department News Cao is part of a team selected by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency to develop cyber reasoning systems using artificial intelligence technology. Ali Madooei receives Whiting School of Engineering Excellence in Teaching Award Categories Awards and Honors The award honors extraordinary dedication to the university’s teaching mission, exceptional performance in the classroom, and a continuing commitment to tomorrow’s leaders. The importance of ambiguity Categories Research Johns Hopkins researchers find that large language models can handle multiple interpretations of the same sentence—but only if they’re told to. Chien-Ming Huang awarded Hopkins AITC funding Categories Awards and Honors This round of grant recipients will receive funding to develop new artificial intelligence technologies to promote healthy aging.
